DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: MONTICELLI, M. A. C. G.;GONZALES, M. A.;GONZALES, M.A.C.;Gonzales, Maria Alice Camargo;Gonzales, Maria Alice

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH:
Arquiteta urbanista, graduada pela Faculdade de Arquitetura e Urbanismo da Universidade de Sуo Paulo - FAU USP (1997). Mestra em Ciъncias pelo Programa de Mestrado Profissional em Inovaчуo na Construчуo Civil, na Escola Politщcnica da Universidade de Sуo Paulo (2016). Doutoranda no programa de Design na FAU USP desde 2020. Щ integrante da equipe da iniciativa IRIS USP, no Centro de Inovaчуo da Universidade de Sуo Paulo - InovaUSP. 

Participou como teacher assistant nos projetos da disciplina Global New Product Design Innovation (ME310) e Stanford University Global Alliance for Redesign (Sugar Network), participando da EXPE 2014 e EXPO 2016 na d.School, Stanford University. Foi monitora na disciplina Desenvolvimento Integrado de Produto, optativa do curso de Engenharia de Produчуo da Escola Politщcnica da USP e do grupo de estudo sobre Educaчуo em Engenharia PoliEdu e щ assistente da disciplina Co-design de aplicativos, no INSPER. Tem experiъncia na сrea de Design e Arquitetura com ъnfase em co-design, design grсfico e arquitetura e cenografia, atuando nos seguintes temas: prototipagem, atividades interativas imersivas em museus de ciъncias, layout para ambiente de pesquisa.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN:
Urban Architect, graduated from the School of Architecture and Urbanism of the University of Sуo Paulo - FAU USP (1997). Master of Science by the Professional Master's Program in Innovation in Civil Construction, at the Polytechnic School of the University of Sуo Paulo (2016). PhD candidate in the Design program at FAU USP since 2020. She is a member of the IRIS USP initiative team, at the Innovation Center of the University of Sуo Paulo - InovaUSP. 

Participated as a teacher assistant in the Global New Product Design Innovation (ME310) and Stanford University Global Alliance for Redesign (Sugar Network) projects, participating in EXPE 2014 and EXPO 2016 at d.School, Stanford University. She was an instructor in the Integrated Product Development, an elective subject in the Production Engineering course at Escola Politщcnica da USP and in the study group about Engineering Education PoliEdu She is teacher assistant of the subject Co-design of applications, at INSPER. She has experience in the area of Design and Architecture with emphasis in co-design, graphic design and architecture and set design, working on the following themes: prototyping, immersive interactive activities in science museums, layout for research environment.
